features.title: Pipeline D: Training Data Implementation
features.description: Complete the training data pipeline to transform Parquet event data into RL-ready training batches. This enables machine learning models to train on historical trading data with proper observation/action/reward structures.
features.rationale: Core blocker for RL model training - users cannot train bots without a working data pipeline. This directly addresses the pain point of 'Difficulty collecting high-quality training data for RL models'.
acceptance_criteria: Observation schema extracts 36 features from Parquet events
Transitions (obs, action, reward, next_obs, done) are correctly generated
Batch loader provides training-ready data to RL frameworks
Integration tests verify pipeline with real captured data
user_stories: As an ML researcher, I want to load captured trading sessions as training data so that I can train RL models on historical patterns
As a data scientist, I want consistent feature extraction so that model training is reproducible

features.title: Protocol Explorer UI (Phase 12E)
features.description: Visual interface for exploring WebSocket protocol events, showing event types, payloads, and timing. Enables users to understand the rugs.fun protocol without reading raw JSON.
features.rationale: Users need visibility into the protocol to debug bot behavior and understand game mechanics. Currently protocol understanding requires reading raw Parquet/JSON files.
acceptance_criteria: Event timeline shows captured WebSocket events chronologically
Event detail pane displays parsed payload with field explanations
Filter by event type (playerUpdate, newTrade, priceUpdate, etc.)
user_stories: As a developer, I want to visualize WebSocket events so that I can understand how the rugs.fun protocol works
As a trader, I want to see what events my trades generate so that I can verify bot behavior

features.title: Legacy Recorder Cleanup
features.description: Remove deprecated recorder files (demo_recorder.py, recorder_sink.py, unified_recorder.py, raw_capture_recorder.py) that have been replaced by EventStore. Eliminates confusion and reduces maintenance burden.
features.rationale: Technical debt from REPLAYER fork - these files are marked for deletion in issue #137. Their presence causes confusion about which system is canonical.
acceptance_criteria: All legacy recorder files are deleted
user_stories: As a developer, I want a single canonical recording system so that I don't have to guess which one to use

features.title: Ruff Linting Compliance
features.description: Address temporarily ignored Ruff rules (B904, N806, N803, etc.) and bring codebase to full linting compliance. Improves code quality and catches bugs early.
features.rationale: Technical debt noted in CLAUDE.md - relaxed linting during migration should be tightened now that core features are stable.
acceptance_criteria: All Ruff ignore rules removed from pyproject.toml
user_stories: As a developer, I want consistent code style so that reviews focus on logic not formatting

features.title: MyPy Strict Type Checking
features.description: Re-enable strict MyPy settings that were relaxed during migration. Add type hints where missing and ensure type safety across the codebase.
features.rationale: Type checking catches bugs before runtime - relaxed settings should be restored now that the architecture is stable.
acceptance_criteria: MyPy runs in strict mode with no errors
All public APIs have type hints
CI enforces type checking on all PRs
user_stories: As a developer, I want type-safe code so that IDE autocomplete works and runtime errors are prevented

features.title: RAG Search UI for Trading History
features.description: Natural language search interface over trading history using ChromaDB. Users can ask questions like 'Show me all profitable trades from last week' and get relevant results.
features.rationale: Addresses the pain point 'Lack of semantic search across trading event history'. ChromaDB integration exists but lacks user-facing search UI.
acceptance_criteria: Search input accepts natural language queries
Results show relevant events with relevance scores
Click-through to event details in Protocol Explorer
Search history saved for quick re-queries
Response time under 2 seconds for typical queries
user_stories: As a trader, I want to search my trading history with natural language so that I can quickly find relevant patterns
As a data scientist, I want semantic search so that I can explore data without writing SQL

features.title: GUI Thread Safety Improvements
features.description: Ensure all UI updates happen on the main thread, eliminating race conditions and crashes during high-frequency event processing.
features.rationale: Known gap from Phase 3 work - high-frequency trading puts stress on GUI updates. Thread-safe patterns prevent freezes and crashes.
acceptance_criteria: All EventBus callbacks schedule UI updates via after()
No tkinter calls from background threads
Stress test with 100 events/second shows no freezes
Thread safety verified with helgrind or similar
user_stories: As a trader, I want the UI to remain responsive during high-frequency trading so that I can monitor positions

features.title: Performance Monitoring Dashboard
features.description: Real-time dashboard showing key metrics: latency chain, events/second, Parquet write performance, and bot execution timing.
features.rationale: Performance visibility is critical for bot optimization. The latency tracking chain exists but needs visualization.
acceptance_criteria: Events per second counter with rolling average
user_stories: As a trader, I want to see my bot's latency so that I can optimize for faster execution
As a developer, I want performance metrics so that I can identify bottlenecks

features.title: Production Deployment Pipeline
features.description: Complete deployment automation with Docker containerization, environment configuration, and rollback capability.
features.rationale: Known gap - no production deployment pipeline exists. Users must manually configure environments.
acceptance_criteria: Rollback to previous version in under 5 minutes
user_stories: As a developer, I want one-command deployment so that releases are consistent
As an operator, I want rollback capability so that I can recover from bad deployments

features.title: Pathlib Migration
features.description: Replace os.path usage with pathlib throughout the codebase for more Pythonic path handling and cross-platform compatibility.
features.rationale: Technical debt noted in CLAUDE.md - os.path is legacy, pathlib is the modern approach.
user_stories: As a developer, I want consistent path handling so that code works on all platforms

features.title: Shorting Integration
features.description: Full support for short positions including protocol event capture, position tracking, and bot execution. Currently deferred due to no protocol data captured.
features.rationale: Known gap - shorting is a key rugs.fun feature but protocol integration was deferred. Enables profit in bear markets.
acceptance_criteria: Bot can open and close short positions
user_stories: As a trader, I want to short tokens so that I can profit in bear markets
As an RL researcher, I want short position data so that I can train models for all market conditions

features.title: Multi-Game Session Support
features.description: Monitor and trade across multiple rugs.fun games simultaneously, with independent state tracking and event capture for each.
features.rationale: Power users want to trade multiple games - currently limited to single game focus. Expands trading opportunities.
acceptance_criteria: Game switcher UI for focus changes
Events tagged with game_id for separation
Bot can manage positions across games
user_stories: As a trader, I want to trade multiple games simultaneously so that I can diversify risk
As a power user, I want to monitor many games so that I can spot opportunities

features.title: Sidegame Integration (BBC, Candleflip)
features.description: Support for rugs.fun sidegames: Bull/Bear/Crab and Candleflip. Currently placeholders exist in schema.
features.rationale: Sidegames are part of rugs.fun but not yet integrated. Expands the platform's value proposition.
acceptance_criteria: UI shows sidegame status and results
user_stories: As a trader, I want to play sidegames so that I can earn additional rewards
As a data scientist, I want sidegame data so that I can analyze player behavior

features.title: Strategy Backtesting Engine
features.description: Run trading strategies against historical Parquet data to evaluate performance before deploying to live trading.
features.rationale: Bot development requires testing strategies without risking capital. Backtesting enables rapid iteration.
acceptance_criteria: Load historical data as backtest session
Execute strategy logic against historical events
user_stories: As a trader, I want to backtest strategies so that I can evaluate them without risking money
As an ML researcher, I want to compare model versions so that I can select the best performer

features.title: High-Frequency Trading Optimization
features.description: Performance optimizations for sub-millisecond trade execution including memory pooling, zero-copy messaging, and optimized event processing.
features.rationale: Known gap - performance optimization for HFT deferred. Competitive advantage requires fastest execution.
acceptance_criteria: Trade execution under 1ms from decision to CDP action
Memory allocation minimized during hot paths
CPU profiling shows no obvious bottlenecks
user_stories: As a competitive trader, I want the fastest execution so that I can front-run other bots

features.title: REST API for External Integrations
features.description: HTTP API exposing VECTRA-PLAYER data and controls for integration with external tools, dashboards, and automation systems.
features.rationale: Power users want to integrate with other systems - portfolio trackers, alert systems, custom UIs. API enables ecosystem.
acceptance_criteria: Endpoints for current state, positions, history
user_stories: As a developer, I want an API so that I can build custom integrations
As a trader, I want webhooks so that I can receive alerts on my phone

features.title: Multi-Wallet Support
features.description: Support for multiple Phantom wallet profiles, enabling trading from different wallets and portfolio isolation.
features.rationale: Advanced users manage multiple wallets for risk isolation and strategy separation. Currently limited to rugs_bot profile.
user_stories: As a trader, I want multiple wallets so that I can isolate risk between strategies

features.title: Strategy Sharing and Community
features.description: Platform for sharing trading strategies and RL models with other VECTRA-PLAYER users. Community features for collaboration.
features.rationale: Future vision - build an ecosystem around VECTRA-PLAYER. Not planned for foreseeable future.
user_stories: As a trader, I want to share my successful strategies so that I can build reputation
As a beginner, I want to learn from others so that I can improve my trading
